sect1.title: Prerequisites for &productcreator;
sect1.para: Before you can create images with the &yast; &productcreator;, make sure you meet the following prerequisites:

listitem.para: Install the package yast2-product-creator from the &sle; SDK. The SDK is an add-on product for &sle; and is available for download from . Search for &sle; Software Development Kit.
Free sufficient disk space for the operation.

sect1.title: Creating Images
sect1.para: The &productcreator; uses &kiwi; to create an image of a product. In case you are interested in manually developing such images, refer to .
To create an image, proceed as follows:

step.para: If you are starting the &productcreator; for the first time, enter the configuration name and choose the method for adding packages to the ISO image.
If you have used the &productcreator; already, select Add to create a new product definition and enter the configuration name and choose the method.

Select or deselect package sources. To select a source, select it from the table and click Select. With Create New... execute the &addoncreator;, see for more information. To add a different source, add the source in the &yast; Installation Sources module first then run the &productcreator; again. After source selection, click Next.

note.title: Unsupported Target Architectures
note.para: Do not change the target architecture. &kiwi; does not presently support the building of different architectures.

step.para: Enter the path in which to create the skeleton directory. Choose whether to Generate ISO Image File or Create Directory Tree Only. Use the other options to insert metadata. Click Next.

Edit the content of the isolinux.cfg file, if it is a part of the configuration. In most cases you can leave it as it is. If the file is not part of the configuration, add it now with Load File. Click Next.
Select your software. All package dependencies are solved automatically after Apply is clicked.

Sign your product with Digitally Sign the Product on the Medium, if needed. Provide a key for your product configuration. Signing your product with your &gpg; key provides evidence of the origin of your product. After key configuration, click Next.
Review the summary. To change any option, use Back. To confirm your new product configuration, click Finish.

sect1.para: Your product definition is now completed. The &productcreator; allows you to choose from the following actions:

formalpara.para: Creates an ISO image of the selected product. If there is something missing, the process will be aborted. Correct the error and repeat the configuration.
Use the pull-down menu to choose from different target formats, such as Live media or Xen images.
